meanings.definition: Obtain (money or assets) illicitly or by deception.
meanings.sent1: He grifted some cash from his friend without permission.
meanings.sent2: The con artist grifted unsuspecting victims out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky cat grifted treats from the pantry when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The magician grifted the audience's attention with his sleight of hand tricks.
meanings.sent5: The thief grifted his way into the vault and stole the jewels.

meanings.definition: Deceive or swindle someone, typically for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: She grifted her brother into giving her extra dessert.
meanings.sent2: The scammer grifted innocent people out of their hard-earned money.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon grifted the campers by stealing their snacks.
meanings.sent4: The smooth-talking salesman grifted customers into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox grifted the chickens out of their feed.
